content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Sure, here's a Julia function `clean_column` that performs the required cleanup on column names:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    # Lowercase the column name
    col = lowercase(col)
    
    # Strip any leading or trailing whitespaces
    col = strip(col)
    
    # Replace spaces and hyphens with an underscore
    col = replace(col, r"[\s-]" => "_")
    
    return col
end
```

You can use this function to clean column names as follows:

```julia
julia> col1 = " My Column ";
julia> col2 = "First-Column";
julia> clean_column(col1)
"my_column"
julia> clean_column(col2)
"first_column"
```
